title: 108_s1775
content: The Act titled "Health Care Safety Net Amendments Technical Corrections Act of 2003" includes technical amendments. The Health Centers section of the Public Health Service Act is amended to remove certain subparagraphs and paragraphs as per Public Law 107-251. Amendments include changes to subsections related to health center plans. Amendments to the Health Centers section of the Public Health Service Act involve adding, striking, redesignating, and inserting subsections in accordance with Public Law 107-251. Amendments to the Health Centers section of the Public Health Service Act include inserting, redesignating, and striking subsections in various paragraphs. Amendments to the Health Centers section of the Public Health Service Act involve changes to funding amounts for fiscal years 2002 through 2006 and adjustments to specific paragraphs and subparagraphs. Amendments to various sections of the Public Health Service Act include changes to rural health outreach, telehealth services, and mental health services via telehealth. Key modifications involve updating specific subsections and inserting new references. Amendments to the Public Health Service Act involve updating subsection references for telemedicine incentive grants. SEC. 330L. Telemedicine; incentive grants for coordination among states. The Secretary may grant funds to State licensing boards to reduce barriers to telemedicine. Appropriations are authorized for fiscal years 2002-2006. Section 102 of the Health Care Safety Net Amendments of 2002 is repealed. Amendments are made to Section 332 of the Public Health Service Act regarding Health Professional Shortage Areas. The Secretary may submit a report if regulations are issued that revise the definition of a health professional shortage area or the standards concerning it. The Secretary shall prepare and submit a report to specific committees upon issuing a regulation that revises standards for health professional shortage areas. The regulation will take effect 180 days after the committees receive the report. Additionally, subsection (b) of a specific law is repealed, and there is an amendment regarding the assignment of Corps Personnel in the Public Health Service Act. The alignment of margins for subparagraphs in various sections of the Public Health Service Act is amended. This includes changes in the assignment of Corps Personnel, charges for services, the National Health Service Corps Scholarship Program, and the National Health Service Corps Loan Repayment Program. The Public Health Service Act is amended to address breach of contract issues and bankruptcy discharge, with a specific repeal of subsection (b) of a previous law. The Public Health Service Act is amended to update various sections by removing specific references and replacing them with new ones. Additionally, the Health Care Safety Net Amendments of 2002 are also amended to update certain provisions related to healthcare financing and research. The Public Health Service Act is amended to update sections related to healthcare financing and research, including guarantees of solvency for managed care networks or plans. SEC. 3. EFFECTIVE DATE. This Act is deemed to have taken effect immediately after the enactment of Public Law 107-251.
